content: Hello! Thanks for reaching out to XYZ Home Services. My name is Ava, and I’m here to help schedule your service. Can I get your name, please?
Why do you need my name? Let’s just get on with it—I need my AC looked at.
Of course! I’ll do my best to help. May I please have your address so I can confirm we can assist you with your air conditioning?
It’s 817 West Elm Street. But last time you ‘confirmed’, someone came late. I don’t want a repeat of that.
Thank you for your address. We do serve your area and will do everything possible to keep you updated and on time. When would be the best time for us to send an HVAC technician your way?
Well, I work most mornings. But if you say ‘between 9 and 5’ like everyone else, forget it. I want a real appointment time, none of this window nonsense.
Thank you for letting me know. We do our best to provide specific arrival times. Could you share your preferred time, and I will check our technician’s availability for an exact slot?
How about 7 pm? And I’ll be timing them if they’re even one minute late.

Thanks! We can book a technician for 7 pm. There may be a very slight delay depending on prior appointments, but we’ll notify you immediately if anything changes. Would you like an estimate for the visit as well?
Of course I want an estimate. I’m not paying a cent if someone just shows up and says I owe money before even looking at it.

Thank you. Our typical HVAC diagnostics start at $89, which includes a technician visiting and determining the problem. Any repair costs will be shared for approval after diagnosis. Does that work for you?
That’s more than what I paid last year—why is it higher now? You people keep raising prices and doing less work. What if the technician just says it’s ‘complicated’ and doesn’t fix anything?

I understand your concerns. Our diagnostic fee ensures a thorough check and clear explanation before any repairs are started—you won’t be charged for repairs you don’t authorize. If anything isn’t clear after diagnosis, you’re welcome to ask for every detail.
I don’t trust this. I bet you’ll tack on some ‘emergency’ charge or something last minute. You know what? Never mind. I’ll just sweat it out.
reason: Customer declined appointment and expressed dissatisfaction.
